cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: turning northwest then north-northwest toward western Cuba, expected to enter the eastern Gulf of Mexico and curve north toward the west-central Florida coast before crossing the peninsula and moving toward the Georgia–South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (around the Tampa Bay–Big Bend area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Florida Keys, entire Florida peninsula, and the southeast U.S. coast from northeast Florida to South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 31% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) late Thursday into Friday; 8% chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal and St. Johns River inundation possible, but current guidance keeps surge below 3 ft on the NE Florida Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–6 inches of rain as the core crosses the peninsula, bringing flash and urban flooding risk to the Jacksonville area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: River flooding along the lower St. Johns and possible tornadoes in outer rainbands late Thu–Fri.
